item.title: Stop a script when an error occurs in PowerShell
item.description: By default, PowerShell doesn't stop the script when an error occurs. Instead, it writes the error to the error stream and continues executing the script. You can change this behavior by setting the $ErrorActionPreference variable to Stop. When you do this, PowerShell stops the script when an error occurs.
